VARIANTS.DESCRIPTION: The main variant list for jDip

MAP_DEFINITION.title: Detailed
MAP_DEFINITION.DESCRIPTION: A detailed version of the traditional map. While this map has rich graphical detail, some features such as province highlighting are not available.

MAP_DEFINITION.title: Simple
MAP_DEFINITION.DESCRIPTION: A simplified version of the traditional map.

VARIANT.name: Standard (6 Players)
VARIANT.DESCRIPTION: Standard map, 6 players. Italy has units placed, but is not active; Italian units will hold in place.

VARIANT.name: Standard (5 Players)
VARIANT.DESCRIPTION: Standard map, 5 players. Germany and Italy have units placed, but are not active; German and Italian units will hold in place.

In the 1898 variant, the game starts in Spring of 1898 with each power having one unit. Each country must capture its other home centers before it can build in them.

Note that this version is equivalent to the KL (Ken Lowe) Judge version, which has fixed starting positions.

Author: Randy Davis

VARIANT.name: Britain
VARIANT.DESCRIPTION:
In the Great Britain variant, each English province is a supply center and Britain starts with six armies. Thus, Britain is the "strongest" country, but is unable to do anything until another player agrees to convoy one of his armies (or he is forced to debuild one of his units and then builds a fleet after retaking the supply center).

Authors: Danny Loeb and Bruce McIntyre (independently)

VARIANT.name: Crowded
VARIANT.DESCRIPTION:
In the Crowded variant the standard map is used with the exception of having a supply center in Ruhr. Each of the 35 supply centers starts out as a home center for one of the eleven players. The original seven players start out with their normal units and positions and are joined by the four new players:

Balkan: F Greece, F Rumania, A Serbia, A Bulgaria
Lowland: F Belgium, A Holland, A Ruhr
Norway: F Norway, F Denmark, A Sweden
Spain: F Portugal, A Spain, F Tunis
Victory conditions remain unchanged, at 18 centers.

Author: Simon Szykman.

VARIANT.name: Crowded 1898
VARIANT.DESCRIPTION:
As its name suggests, the Crowded 1898 variant combines an 1898 start (i.e. powers start only owning one of their home centers, and must capture the rest) with the crowded powers. It uses the same map as the regular crowded variant. Victory conditions remain unchanged, at 18 centers.

Author: Tim Miller.

VARIANT.name: Fleet Rome
VARIANT.DESCRIPTION:
Identical to standard map except Italy starts with a fleet in Rome instead of an army. This supposedly gives Italy a slightly stronger position in the initial game.

Author: Richard Sharp.

VARIANT.name: Shift-Left
VARIANT.DESCRIPTION:
A variant in which each power's units start out in a different power's home supply centers. Powers must reach and retake their own home supply centers before they can start building new units.

The starting positions are as follows:

Turkey→Germany (Turkey's units are in Germany)
Russia→Italy
England→Austria
Germany→Turkey
France→Russia
Italy→Britain
Austria→France

Author: Josh Smith

VARIANT.name: Shift-Right
VARIANT.DESCRIPTION:
A variant in which each power's units start out in a different power's home supply centers. Powers must reach and retake their own home supply centers before they can start building new units.

The starting positions are as follows:

Germany→Turkey (Germany's units are in Turkey)
Italy→Russia
Austria→Britain
Turkey→Germany
Russia→France
England→Italy
France→Austria

Author: Josh Smith

VARIANT.name: Shift-Around
VARIANT.DESCRIPTION:
A variant in which each power's units start out in a different power's home supply centers. Powers must reach and retake their own home supply centers before they can start building new units.

The Shift-Around variant follows the same pattern as the original Shift-Left and Shift-Right variants. The only difference is which power starts in which country. The aim is to make the variant more balanced than the other Shift variants.

The starting positions are as follows:

Germany→Turkey (Germany's units are in Turkey)
Italy→England
Austria→France
Turkey→Germany
Russia→Italy
England→Russia
France→Austria

Author: Josh Smith
